page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY NASH AREA
page.content: The two villages, surrounded by several historic farms - Thornton Hall - red brick Georgian. Nash: Celtic - means "asshe" a place where clay is cut. Beachampton: Saxon; Buc-Beech, Ham _ Home/Village, Ton - an enclosure or farm. Many old houses/buildings still exist- Nash: Dove Cottage C13; Tythe Cottage C16; Bass Hill Farm - Georgian; Red House - Victorian. Beachampton: The Grange 1629; Elmers 1652; Red House Farm - Georgian. The schools dated 1857 and 1869 are now the village halls. Focal points are the Churches Nash - All Saints 1857; Beachampton - Church of Assumption of St Mary the Virgin C14. Ancient field names: Thistley - many thistles; Mixons - Dunghill; The Mowings; Hanging Land, etc.
